keyTakeAways: Colombia has recalled its ambassador to the United States, Daniel García-Peña, for consultations, marking a significant escalation in diplomatic tensions.
The recall follows U.S. military actions, including missile attacks on suspected drug-smuggling vessels, which Colombia claims have resulted in the deaths of Colombian citizens.
President Gustavo Petro Urrego accused U.S. President Donald Trump of supporting a plot to remove him from power, a claim the White House dismissed as baseless.
Trump accused Petro of being an 'illegal drug leader' and threatened to cease financial subsidies and raise tariffs on Colombian goods.
This is the second time this year that Colombia has recalled its ambassador to Washington, reflecting ongoing instability in bilateral relations.
The U.S. has deployed warships in the Caribbean and conducted missile strikes on vessels suspected of drug trafficking, resulting in at least seven attacks and 30 deaths.
Colombia claims that some of the victims on these vessels were Colombian nationals, accusing the U.S. of 'murder' and human rights violations.
A Colombian citizen was returned alive from a recently attacked vessel, indicating some operational outcomes of the U.S. military actions.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Colombia has recalled its ambassador to the United States, Daniel García-Peña, for consultations, amid escalating diplomatic tensions over U.S. military actions targeting suspected drug-smuggling vessels in the Caribbean. The move follows claims by Colombian President Gustavo Petro that the U.S. supported a plot to remove him from power and responds to President Donald Trump’s accusation that Petro is an illegal drug leader, along with threats to cut financial aid and raise tariffs on Colombian goods. The U.S. has launched missile strikes on seven vessels, resulting in at least 30 deaths, with Colombia alleging that some of the victims were Colombian nationals, accusing the United States of 'murder'. This marks the second time this year that Colombia has recalled its ambassador, signaling deepening strain in bilateral relations over drug policy and sovereignty.
title: Colombian Ambassador to US Recalled for Consultations Amid Drug and Diplomatic Tensions
